lines.text:
[after a boat has blown up]
Oh, I'm sorry about the explosion. It doesn't happen every day.
I don't come every day.

[about Mrs. Fothergill]
When the moon is full, I fear for my life.
Suffragette!
Psychopath!

I don't know how much you know about Arab etiquette, but the thing that must be avoided above all is familiarity. These chaps are as proud as Lucifer, and a woman among Muslims must be particularly careful.

[Advising Modesty]
A woman amongst Muslims has to be particularly careful.

[after watching her strangle a man with her feet]
Have you ever wondered about Mr. Fothergill?
I am Mr. Fothergill.

[Speaking of Gabriel's criminal career]
The Royal Box at Ascot... picking pockets.
One has to start somewhere, you know.
Your first mistake.

[Pointing his finger reprovingly]
My last!
You know, you really are very beautiful.
I haven't been dead for 42 years.
Very good for one's image.
Mmmm.

[Noticing a tattoo scorpion on Modesty's leg when she grabs it]
Ah... Scorpio.
There's a sting in my tail. Mmm-hmm.
I am the villain of the piece. I have to condemn you.
But I am the heroine. Don't I get away?
Perhaps.
Where are you taking me?
You are on board the Andronicus bound from Bizerte to Dubroynik with a cargo of fruits and nuts.
He's a fruit merchant, see?
He is a nut.
That's enough of that.

[Staked out in the hot sun and very thirsty]
Champagne... champagne... champagne.

[to Pacco]
If the girl is alive tomorrow night, you won't be.
